content: goldhanger square by jacqui goulbourn difficulty level intermediate terminology us terms skills required front post and back post stitches and popcorns yarn any weight of yarn according to the required size of the finished square the sample is shown in yarnsmiths create dk hook size to achieve gauge size 12 inch square in worsted weight yarn 8 5 inches in dk weight introduction this square is compatible with the ravelry block a month cal selected squares in that it should measure 12 inches if worked in worsted weight yarn and has a stitch count of 39 sts per side i have used yarnsmiths create dk in a lime green b off white c duck egg and d light turquoise e dark turquoise the photo tutorial uses stylecraft special dk in colours a mustard b lapis c aspen d lobelia and e shrimp goldhanger is a village on the north bank of the blackwater estuary near maldon it is also home to a community owned farm which gives opportunities for the learning disabled to work alongside other volunteers growing vegetables and raising animals this includes one of the few flocks of north ronaldsay sheep outside of scotland - their undyed wool is available for purchase this pdf download is safe to use and free from viruses it has no embedded links find more of my designs at www catkitbob com www ravelry com/designers/jacqui-goulbourn https //payhip com/catkitbobdesigns catkitbob designs goldhanger122025v1 page 1 of 6 abbreviations bpdc back post double_crochet round s round s bphdc back post half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet chain chain stitch skip skip chain-space chain space slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet space s space s half_double_crochet half_double_crochet st s stitch es fpdc front post double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet fphdc front post half_double_crochet popcorn work 5 double_crochet in same base st remove hook from loop and insert it in top of first double_crochet pull working loop through goldhanger square instructions general notes - the 1st double_crochet of each round can be worked either as chain 3 or standing double_crochet for 1st half_double_crochet chain 2 or standing half_double_crochet this also applies when starting a round with a popcorn st - finish each round by joining to the top of the first st of the round - colour changes are indicated in 2nd column there are not specific instructions to finish off each colour - depending on your gauge some rnds may not lie flat but later rnds will correct this notes on jacob s ladder construction the chains of 9 stitches are to be interwoven to form a jacob s ladder this can be done as you go or after completing the final chain of 9 stitches to form the ladder take the first chain of 9 sts round 7 behind and under the ch2 of round 6 to leave a loop at the front of your work take the chain of 9 sts round 8 behind and pull through the loop of round 7 stitches repeat this last step on all subsequent rounds you
